intro: Peucedanum yakushimense, commonly known as Yakushimense hogweed, is a member of the Apiaceae family and is native to Japan. It is a tall biennial plant that can grow up to 2 meters in height, with large, compound leaves and clusters of small, white or greenish-yellow flowers. The plant produces small, oval fruits that are surrounded by bracts. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forested areas. Due to its tall stature and showy flowers, it is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
